description: This dataset contains economic variables gathered from the American Community Survey (ACS) from 2018 to 2022. It includes data related to household income, unemployment, poverty levels, and SNAP benefits, providing insights into economic conditions at the Census tract level.
source: American Community Survey 5-year data - U.S. Census Bureau

variables.name: median_income
variables.description: Median Household Income in the Past 12 Months (in 2022 Inflation-Adjusted Dollars)

variables.name: unemployment_rate
variables.description: Unemployment rate of the civilian labor force

variables.name: poverty_rate
variables.description: Percentage of all people whose income in the past 12 months is below the poverty level

variables.name: snap_benefits
variables.description: Percentage of total households with Food Stamp/SNAP benefits in the past 12 months

notes: GEOIDs correspond to Census tracts for the given year of the dataset. Note that Census tract boundaries have changed after the 2020 decennial census, which may affect geographic consistency over time.
